result.execSummary:
All charges against Tony Antwan Clay Sr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tony Antwan Clay Sr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tony Antwan Clay Sr not in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Tony Antwan Clay Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.
State moves to dismiss for reasons set forth in the record. Defense does not object.
On motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed without prejudice. 
Court vacates the 10/17/2022 Jury Trial.

Defendant Tony Antwan Clay in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tony Antwan Clay appeared by video means with Attorney.   Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tony Antwan Clay in court with Attorney Michael Plaisted. Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case recalled at 3:08 pm in court for indigency hearing. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Michael Plaisted, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $35.00 per month beginning 10/01/2022, and then the 1st of each month there after until completion of payment. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Status of Counsel date in Branch 37.

Defendant Tony Antwan Clay in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for indigency hearing. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  Indigency Hearing held. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.   Court intends to appoint attorney Michael Plaisted and passed case to 3:00 pm when attorney is available.

Defendant Tony Antwan Clay in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to self representation.  Defendant informed the court that he wishes to proceed pro se.  Court provided the defendant with indigency paperwork.

Defendant Tony Antwan Clay in court.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant informed the Court he would like to represent himself.  Court ordered an in-person hearing be set.  Case is adjourned to Br. 37.  Hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DAS or her residence and BMH or her residence.

Defendant Tony Antwan Clay in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 2213 North 38th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/13/22 @ 1p
